image.altText: A young man with shoulder-length red hair and a young woman with braided blonde hair.

props.synopsis: Jack and Anna swapped the humidity of Queensland for chilly days in Tasmania, but is Tasmania really the climate refuge many think it is?

title.children: 'This is not normal': Australians moving to Tasmania to escape climate heat

image.altText: A large, roofed circular stadium near Hobart's CBD, seen from the air.

props.synopsis: In the first Question Time since the release of the Tasmanian Planning Commission's damning report on the Hobart AFL stadium, the Labor Party questioned the government's ability to deliver the stadium, while an independent labelled it a "dud deal".

title.children: Cost blowout criticised as stadium debate rages in Tasmanian parliament

image.altText: A woman in a red sweater looks at the camera as she leaves a court building followed by a man and another woman

props.synopsis: Cedric and Noelene Jordan's attempt to overturn their conviction for the murder of their former son-in-law in 2009 has failed, with the Court of Criminal Appeal rejecting it on all grounds.

title.children: 'Not a scintilla of reasonable doubt': Court rejects killer couple's appeal

image.altText: Black lines hide information in a document

props.synopsis: From pulp mills to stadiums, Tasmanians don't have access to information about how and why decisions are made. A review of the state's transparency system says this — and many other things — should change.

title.children: Tasmanian cabinet decisions should be made public, review says

image.altText: A man sits at a desk.

props.synopsis: The Australian Securities and Investments Commission took Dave Hodgson and two of his companies to the Federal Court, alleging they were operating without the required financial services licence, and had made misrepresentations to investors.

title.children: Judge finds businessman had 'magic pudding' approach to valuing company

image.altText: a man wearing a hat and backpack in thick green forest

props.synopsis: YouTuber Rob Parsons has used Celine Cremer's phone data to retrace her steps in forest near Philosopher Falls.

title.children: YouTuber retraces last GPS points of missing Belgian tourist

image.altText: Julia Yarzar  holds up a bottle of liquid melatonin

props.synopsis: The ABC has analysed data from poisons hotlines across the country, revealing almost 1,500 calls were made about children taking melatonin last year, a dramatic rise on previous figures.

title.children: 'Purely luck' no-one has died after dramatic rise in melatonin use, experts warn

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: The federal government has yet to pass legislation to empower a new coordinator for the emergency services line, but experts say tougher conditions are needed on the telco itself.

title.children: Incoming triple-0 reforms may not have helped prevent Optus failure

image.altText: Andrew Hastie Instagram

props.synopsis: Senior Liberal Andrew Hastie has taken aim at colleagues who questioned a social media post where he bemoaned the loss of Australian car making, calling them "nameless cowards" and "muppets".

title.children: 'Nameless cowards, muppets': Andrew Hastie unleashes on Liberal colleagues

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sitting in the Kremlin.

props.synopsis: The report is based on detailed interviews with 215 former detainees captured since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

title.children: Russia systematically torturing Ukrainian civilians, UN says

image.altText: There is a sunrise with lots of different colors over the beach with two people standing at the water.

props.synopsis: It's the same question every year: Do we gain or lose an hour when daylight saving time comes into effect in October? Here's what you need to know.

title.children: Daylight saving time is about to start. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: An illustration of an man wearing green top with glasses and grey hair

props.synopsis: Glenn Cameron has remained in custody since he was arrested in February last year and charged with more than 30 offences in relation to eight victims.

title.children: How airport schooner helped police capture Sydney's 'Night Stalker'

image.altText: A person holding a mobile phone surrounded by icons from social media platforms

props.synopsis: WhatsApp, Roblox, Reddit and Discord are among an expanded list of platforms which may be covered by the teen social media ban, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Not just 'big fish': eSafety reveals new platforms may be forced to ban teens

image.altText: A woman sitting on the roof of a house using her mobile phone as floodwaters can be seen on the street below.

props.synopsis: The storm, which is the most powerful so far in 2025, is now heading towards the Chinese mainland, prompting widespread disruption and warnings of sea surges.

title.children: Super Typhoon Ragasa lashes Taiwan, with two dead and 30 missing

image.altText: Police officers look towards the sky as they stand along a fenced area in front of a police car at nighttime

props.synopsis: Denmark links incident involving drones over its main airport to a series of recent suspected Russian drone incursions and other hybrid attacks across Europe.

title.children: Denmark not ruling out Russian involvement in airport drones

image.altText: Passengers crowd around waiting at Parramatta train station

props.synopsis: A review into Sydney's train chaos in May was scathing. So how will the government fix the city's ailing rail network?

title.children: How NSW government plans to fix Sydney's rail network

image.altText: Bright yellow canola flowers in a paddock fill the frame.

props.synopsis: Selfie hunters seeking the perfect social media photo among flowering canola are putting their safety and growers' livelihoods at risk, farmers say.

title.children: Farmers notice more canola crop trespassers wandering into paddocks

image.altText: Sarah, the Duchess of York, walking out wearing a white and black blazer, waving at the crowd with a black glove on her hand.

props.synopsis: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

title.children: Multiple charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Epstein

image.altText: A man stands in a town square where a vendor sells colourful bags

props.synopsis: Australia joined nine other nations in formally recognising Palestinian statehood at the UN this week. But Palestinians have mixed feelings.

title.children: In the West Bank, Palestinians have mixed feelings about the growing statehood push

image.altText: Siraj Mohamed.

props.synopsis: There are a million children living in Gaza through the war between Israel and Hamas. Foreign Correspondent follows one young family trying to survive.

title.children: 'I stood still': The night-time stalker that terrorised 10yo Siraj in Gaza

image.altText: A man in navy uniform and emblem of a red flag demonstrates a martial arts move to two other men in lighter blue uniform

props.synopsis: Vanuatu declares it will sign a new policing agreement with China as the landmark Nakamal pact between Australia and the Pacific Island nation hangs in the balance.

title.children: Vanuatu to sign China police deal as security pact with Australia lies in limbo

image.altText: A light brown beetle and smaller brown larvae pictured in a microscopic picture with grains of rice in background.

props.synopsis: The estimated cost of the invasive khapra beetle to Australia's grains industry could be more than $15 billion if it became endemic across the country after being discovered in imported nappy pants.

title.children: Pest found in nappy pants could cost grains industry $15b if not contained

image.altText: A stack of pills on a table

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

title.children: Why Australian experts say Trump's autism claims are 'baseless'

image.altText: A Hawthorn player tackles a Geelong player from behind as they fall to the ground.

props.synopsis: The AFL tribunal quashes Mabior Chol's three-match ban for rough conduct, finding he did not act unreasonably in his tackle which left Geelong's Tom Stewart concussed and out of this weekend's grand final.

title.children: Hawthorn's Chol free to play in 2026 after three-match ban is overturned

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.

title.children: How the Optus triple-0 outage unfolded

image.altText: An AFLW player looks serious as she walks off the field with two teammates behind her at half-time.

props.synopsis: Former AFLW player claims she was spat at during her community grand final as ex-players are being targeted at local leagues.

title.children: Former AFLW player alleges she was spat at during local league grand final

image.altText: Unidentified male hands holding smartphone with dating app Grindr logo on screen.

props.synopsis: Two "lawless" and "cruel" teenage boys who used social media to lure gay men to isolated locations in Perth before attacking them will remain in detention.

title.children: More Perth teens sentenced for bashing, torture of men lured on Grindr

image.altText: Awamr of bees partially covers a footpath sign advertising dumplings.

props.synopsis: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

title.children: 'People running through the street' as bees swarm Wagga Wagga CBD

image.altText: Hannah Thomas with eye patch in black hoodie

props.synopsis: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

title.children: NSW Police officer charged with assault over arrest of former Greens candidate

image.altText: RACQ sign

props.synopsis: The corporate watchdog alleges RACQ knowingly misled over 500,000 customers in insurance renewal notices since 2019.

title.children: A major insurer has been sued for misleading customers. Are you one of them?

image.altText: Commuters board a Sydney train

props.synopsis: A scathing report into Sydney Trains has put a "disturbing" spotlight on the "absence of effective communications" and "information voids" on the network, but one transport expert says this was not always the case.

title.children: The key change that could make Sydney train commuters' lives easier

image.altText: A woman sits with her head down

props.synopsis: Hakyung Lee admitted to giving her two children an overdose of prescription medicine before changing her name and leaving New Zealand.

title.children: Mother found guilty of murdering two children found in suitcases

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel with hands out, wearing a suit and bow tie, standing on stage, brown background

props.synopsis: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

title.children: Jimmy Kimmel to go back on air after Charlie Kirk comments

image.altText: A police car park next to a sign that says "park entrance"

props.synopsis: One of the youngest Australians ever to be charged with murder will face a jury trial over the stabbing death in a Hervey Bay caravan park of a 24-year-old man in August 2024.

title.children: Court hears girl to stand trial for murder told mother she 'stabbed a paedo'

image.altText: Black and white photo of two people smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A South Australian kitchen manufacturer says a scammer has tried to extort money to remove several fake one-star reviews posted to Google.

title.children: SA business asked to pay $US200 to remove fake one-star Google reviews
